Author: toffer
Content:
I love Costco. For me, the best quote of the article was this:

"The traditional retailer will say: 'I'm selling this for $10. I wonder whether I can get $10.50 or $11.' We say: 'We're selling it for $9. How do we get it down to $8?'"

Title: eBay Imports Kijiji: Good Idea, Tough Competition

Author: henning
Content: the more people who use something, the easier it is to use it to build products.

Author: brett
Content:
"But Mr. Sinegal warned that if Costco increased markups to 16 or 18 percent, the company might slip down a dangerous slope and lose discipline in minimizing costs and prices."

Costco's strict attitude toward product markup reminds me of 37Signals frequent assertion that often constraints are a good thing to be embraced.

Content: The last paragraph is out of nowhere. Nice.
